clinical_study.brief_title: Mechanisms of Nudges on Families' Decision-Making Process
clinical_study.official_title: Mechanisms of Nudges on Families' Decision-Making Process

brief_summary.textblock: As part of a larger study, participants are told to read 1 out of 4 anecdotes depicting an organ donation scenario where they are required to make a decision on behalf of their mother who has just suffered an accident. The participants are then surveyed on their attitudes towards organ donation.

detailed_description.textblock: As part of a larger study, participants are given 1 out of 4 possible vignettes which depicts an organ donation scenario involving their mother. The possible vignettes consist of a Control condition, a Framing condition, a Normative condition and a condition that includes all the nudges. Participants are then given surveys to gauge their views and attitudes towards organ donation as a whole, their trust towards medical institutions and the doctors, their perceived manipulation from the doctor and their views on the altruistic nature of organ donation.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are assigned to 1 out of 4 possible anecdotes; Control, Framing, Norms, Combination.

primary_outcome.measure: 5-point Likert scale - Trust and Perceived Manipulativeness of doctor and medical institution
primary_outcome.description: A 5-point Likert scale will be given and participants will be asked to rate their agreeableness towards the level of trust and perceived manipulativeness of the doctor and the medical institution.

primary_outcome.measure: 9-point rating scale - Views on altruistic nature of organ donation
primary_outcome.description: A 9-point rating scale will be given and participants will be asked to rate their views on the meaningfulness of organ donation.

arm_group.description: Vignette is framed in a particular manner
Vignette contains extra information about norms
Vignette contains extra information about norms and is framed in a particular manner.

intervention.description: Vignette is framed in a way that nudges participant to leave a legacy
Vignette informs the participant that most people choose an option to try to nudge participant into choosing that option as well

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Above age 21
- Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents
Exclusion Criteria:
- Below age 21
- Non-citizens
- Not able to make decisions for self
